confidentiality.notes: Data intercepting encrypted forum submissions, passwords sent during login sessions, authentication cookies, private messages and more, Theymos wrote

notes: http://www.cio.com/article/2380571/security0/bitcointalk-org-warns-passwords-in-danger-after-dns-attack.html;https://bitcointalk.org  The Bitcoin Forum  secondary victim Anonymous Speech   breach 2013-11-24 notification 2013-11-25   Data intercepting encrypted forum submissions, passwords sent during login sessions, authentication cookies, private messages and more, Theymos wrote  Vector DNS registrar vulnerability
summary: IDG News Service _ A popular Bitcoin discussion forum warned on Monday some user passwords may have been intercepted after the site's DNS (Domain Name System) registrar was breached.  An attacker found a flaw in Bitcointalk.org's domain name registrar, a company based in Japan called Anonymous Speech, wrote an administrator for the forum who goes by the nickname "Theymos." Anonymous Speech could not immediately be reached for comment.
